Assessment.QuestionText: Which of these statements about printing classes are true and which statements are false?

Options.Option: The information needed for <font face="courier new">BeginPrint</font> and <font face="courier new">EndPrint</font> events are provided by <font face="courier new">PrintEventArgs</font> class.
The <font face="courier new">IsPreview</font> property of <font face="courier new">PrintController</font> class is used to indicate whether the document can be previewed or not.
The <font face="courier new">PrintAction</font> property of <font face="courier new">PrintEventArgs</font> class is used to print the document.
The <font face="courier new">Bounds</font> property of <font face="courier new">PageSettings</font> class is used to get the page coordinates.
The <font face="courier new">Reset()</font> method of <font face="courier new">PrintDialog</font> class is used to select a printer.

Assessment.CorrectFeedback: Yes, that's correct! You get one point for your response.
Assessment.incorrectFeedback: No, that's incorrect. The correct selections are: (A)-(True), (B)-(True), (C)-(False), (D)-(False), and (E)-(False).
